plants.name: Chrysanthemum morifolium
plants.description: Chrysanthemums are popular garden flowers known for their vibrant blooms in various shapes and colors. They are a symbol of autumn in many cultures and are often used in floral arrangements during fall.
plants.location: Temperate regions worldwide (native to East Asia)
plants.funFact: Chrysanthemums are the flower of the Japanese emperor and the imperial family, symbolizing longevity and rejuvenation.

plants.name: Erica carnea
plants.description: A low-growing evergreen shrub that produces small bell-shaped flowers. It is one of the earliest blooming heathers, often starting to bloom in autumn and continuing into winter.
plants.location: Central and Southern Europe, cultivars grown in temperate gardens worldwide
plants.funFact: Winter Heath can bloom even under snow, making it a symbol of perseverance in harsh winter conditions.

plants.name: Nicotiana alata
plants.description: An ornamental plant with fragrant tubular flowers that open in the evening and attract pollinators such as moths. Widely grown in gardens for its pleasant scent and colorful flowers.
plants.location: South America (native), cultivated widely in subtropical and temperate gardens
plants.funFact: The flower's scent intensifies at night to attract nocturnal pollinators.

plants.name: Grevillea robusta
plants.description: A fast-growing tree with bright orange to yellow spider-like flowers. Native to eastern Australia, it blooms in spring to autumn, providing nectar for birds and insects.
plants.location: Australia, cultivated in subtropical and Mediterranean climates worldwide
plants.funFact: Despite its common name, Silky Oak is not an oak but a member of the Proteaceae family.
